io.sarl.core

Capacity DefaultContextInteractions

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Capacity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultContextInteractionsSkill

    public interface DefaultContextInteractions
extends Capacity
    Gives access to the DefaultContext of the agent and common actions on its default space. Defines a set of commonly accessed action performed on the Default Space of the Default Context of the agent.

def getDefaultSpace() : EventSpace

        Returns:
        the default event space.

      • getDefaultAddress

        @Pure
def getDefaultAddress() : Address 
        Description copied from interface: DefaultContextInteractions
        Return the Address of the agent in the Default Space of the Default Context. Equivalent to defaultContext.defaultSpace.getAddress(this.ID)
        Returns:
        the address of the agent in the default space.

      • emit

        def emit(event : Event,
         scope : Scope<Address> = null) : void 
        Description copied from interface: DefaultContextInteractions
        Emits a given event with the provided scope in the DefaultSpace of the DefaultContext. Equivalent to defaultContext.defaultSpace.emit(e,scope)
        Parameters:
        event - the event to emit.
        scope - the definition of the scope that will be used for selected the receivers of the events. If null, all the agents in the space will receive the event.

      • receive

        @Deprecated
def receive(receiver : UUID,
                        event : Event) : void 
        Deprecated. see DefaultContextInteractions.willReceive(UUID, Event)
        Description copied from interface: DefaultContextInteractions
        Inverse signature of send. Useful to send events using the agent's UUID. Example: If you need to send an event to a newly created agent you should usually do : ... const mySpawnArgs = ... const myAgentAddr = MyAgent.spawn(mySpawnArgs) defaultSpace.emit(new StartWorkingEvent, AddressScope::scope(myAgentAddr) The equivalent using receive could be written: ... MyAgent.spawn(mySpawnArgs).receive(new StartWorkingEvent)
        Parameters:
        receiver - the identifier of the expected receiver.
        event - the event to emit.

      • willReceive

        def willReceive(receiver : UUID,
                event : Event) : void 
        Description copied from interface: DefaultContextInteractions
        Inverse signature of send. Useful to send events using the agent's UUID. Example: If you need to send an event to a newly created agent you should usually do : ... const mySpawnArgs = ... const myAgentAddr = MyAgent.spawn(mySpawnArgs) defaultSpace.emit(new StartWorkingEvent, AddressScope::scope(myAgentAddr))

        The equivalent using receive could be written: ... MyAgent.spawn(mySpawnArgs).willReceive(new StartWorkingEvent)

        Parameters:
        receiver - the identifier of the expected receiver.
        event - the event to emit.
        Since:
        0.4

      • isDefaultSpace

        @Pure
def isDefaultSpace(space : Space) : boolean 
        Description copied from interface: DefaultContextInteractions
        Replies if the given space is the default space of the default context.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • spawn

        @Deprecated
def spawn(agentType : Class<? extends Agent>,
                      params : Object*) : UUID 
        Deprecated. See the Lifecycle capacity.
        Description copied from interface: DefaultContextInteractions
        Spawns a new Agent inside the default context of this agent. This action must automatically register the newly created agent within the default space of the context.
        Parameters:
        agentType - the type of the agent to spawn.
        params - the arguments to pass in the initialization event to the spawned agent.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the spawned agent.
        Fired Events:
        AgentSpawned in DefaultSpace
